content: hello crafters we're back for part two of the demon door so let's finish this
up today we're going to do a little more crafting on the door itself and then
we're going to paint it up and it'll be ready for our table so let's hit the
crafting table and finish up that demon door
so here we go my door is all dry and I'm gonna snip the excess off so I'll just
use some scissors and get it near the end there that makes it easier snip and
hold up my fingers and I cut the bottom shorter than the top because it has to
go through the cork base okay now the top can be a little longer
because it goes up into that doorway arch and look at the nice open action on
that head okay so now I'm gonna mark where the the pivot point on the bottom
of the door goes to the cork and I'll just punch through it with my all and
just get it large enough there that court can kind of heal itself up so you
won't have to punch it a couple times and just line it up and I'll do it again
there yeah just pop that little bit out there and we should be ready now okay
I'm getting money I'm giving it my all haha okay there we go so we got it on
the base and it's nice and in that hole there and we got the arch put it right
over in the middle of the cork and there we go so now I'm going to put some hot
glue on the ends of the arch and glue it to the cork and we'll let that harden up
and there we've got a door constructed so now it's good to go so what I'm gonna
do now is add a little bit of reinforcement where the arch meets the
base just to just for some extra strength there I'm just gonna add some
glue and then just let this dry I just like to do this because it just adds
that extra bit of strength since it's that's the only thing holding it on and
look at that nice door action very cool okay so now I have spray painted it
black now I painted the door with the white glue so that helped to avoid the
the spray paint eating the door but I use my mix of grey burnt sienna and a
coffee to do the stone around the door so I'm just using a wet sponge to sponge
that right on that color combo there and it's seen that nice detail popping up
from the arch and the base now I'm not going to
do the door I'm gonna paint that a different color actually so I'll just go
around make sure I get all that filled in and look at that nice detail with the
stonework the hot glue really a quick and easy way to add that kind of detail
to your pieces and just keep going around add the extra colors and there we
go we're all good so we'll let that dry up now here's the door and it's all
ready to go I mean you say a light gray to kind of dry brush some areas I'm
going to do a little bit of highlight around the base and around the stones
themselves so I'm kind of picking out the highlight areas around the stones
instead of just dry brushing it on and see how that's doing a nice effect
so yeah just the edges of those stones and yeah it's really those stones are
really popping out now see that detail it's just so cool I love it a little bit
of flicking on the base and I'm good to go so I'll do the back the same on the
back also so they'll be the same okay so now we have our door and I'm going to
use a metallic black to paint the door you don't want to hit the spray paint
too much because you don't want to melt the foam too much so I just kind of
lightly hit it with a spray paint but this will help fill in all that little
detail places the spray paint didn't hit it also gives it a nice metallic sheen
actually so I kind of like that so I'll paint that up and do both sides
now that's dried I'm going to use a metallic bronze and I'm gonna pick out
the details of the demon and the door banding on the edge so I'll just I'm
using a really thin brush and just going around and picking out that nice detail
we spent all that time using the ink pin putting into the door and look at that
look at that popping out from that black door so cool so get some horns and then
all those little details you could dry brush this but I feel that you have more
of a danger of getting in the crevices if you do it this way it's a little more
time-consuming but you can pick out all the details individually and then you
won't have to worry about filling up they're covering up some details with
your dry brushing so I just keep picking out those those high points on the
demon's face and it's really starting to fill in now I got the teeth finishing up
those the jaw they're the horns on the bottom and the side horn and yeah look
at that just really popping out of that black metallic door just super cool so
there we go there's our demon head now let's go to the table here I set up a
hallway some with some brazzers and the demon door at the end of the hallway
with my 2.5 D next technique and the adventures wander in and they
encountered this door so you could do all kinds of stuff you could have
riddles the door gives them a riddle it could be a trap if they don't do disarm
it it could shoot fireballs out of the eyes or something too while it taunts
them so yeah there you go now let's let me give you a closer look at this and
you can see that really nice detail the hot glue made on the door edge there
that's super cool and it was just really really easy to do now there's the door
swings open has a nice action there with the hinge from the Roku stick and there
we go the demons really pop and I really like
the effect of the bronze on the black so there you go there's a demon door hey
crafters I hope you really liked the diamond door make sure to give your
Scottie a like' if you did like the crafts also make sure to share and
subscribe if you're not already and why not join my forum and Facebook group a
bunch of great crafters with some good advice and last but not least go forth
and craft it riddle me this dumb demon door who is dead sexy has awesome Ranger
skills and is tired of your riddles you don't know do you demon door it's me
yeah
